    <span id="ctl00_MainContent_DetailedOutput"><h1 class="title">Evangelist</h1>The velstracs’ unofficial ambassadors, evangelists roam the farthest reaches of the planes to spread the word of their kind’s abhorrent belief in perfection through pain. They are therefore the most frequently encountered velstracs on the Material Plane, often leading covens of hedonistic mortal flesh-sculptors or serving as wardens of horrific dungeons. In regions ruled by infernal powers, evangelists may serve as lieutenants or advisors, whispering secret paths to power in exchange for mortals’ souls or choice mortal flesh.<br /><br /> Evangelists are the same size as humans, although with their heavy chains, they often weigh 350 pounds or more.<br /><br /><b><u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=5&General=true">Recall Knowledge - Fiend</a></u> (<u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=13">Religion</a></u>)</b>: DC 24<h1 class="title"><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=461">Evangelist</a><span style="float:right;">Creature 6</span></h1><a target="_blank" href="Images\Monsters\Velstrac_Evangelist.png"><img class="thumbnail" src="Images\Monsters\Velstrac_Evangelist.png"></a><span alt="Uncommon Trait" class="traituncommon" title="Something of uncommon rarity requires special training or comes from a particular culture or part of the world. Some character choices give access to uncommon options, and the GM can choose to allow access for anyone. Less is known about uncommon creatures than common creatures. They typically can’t be summoned. The DC of Recall Knowledge checks related to these creature is increased by 2."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=159">Uncommon</a></span><span alt="Lawful Evil" class="traitalignment" title="Lawful Evil">LE</span><span alt="Medium" class="traitsize" title="Medium">Medium</span><span alt="Fiend Trait" class="trait" title="Creatures that hail from or have a strong connection to the evil-aligned planes are called fiends. Fiends can survive the basic environmental effects of planes in the Outer Sphere."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=70">Fiend</a></span><span alt="Velstrac Trait" class="trait" title="<i>Note from Nethys: no description was provided for this trait</i>"><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=265">Velstrac</a></span><br /><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01zrs?Pathfinder-Adventure-Path-147-Tomorrow-Must-Burn" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Pathfinder #147: Tomorrow Must Burn pg. 83</i></a><br /><b>Perception</b> +13; darkvision, painsight<br /><b>Languages</b> <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=1"><u>Common</a></u>, <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=19"><u>Infernal</a></u>, <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=21"><u>Shadowtongue</a></u><br /><b>Skills</b> <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=1"><u>Acrobatics</a></u> +13, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=3"><u>Athletics</a></u> +15, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=4"><u>Crafting</a></u> +10, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=7"><u>Intimidation</a></u> +15, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=13"><u>Religion</a></u> +11, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=8"><u>Torture Lore</a></u> +12<br /><b>Str</b> +4, <b>Dex</b> +3, <b>Con</b> +2, <b>Int</b> +0, <b>Wis</b> +1, <b>Cha</b> +1<br /><b>Painsight</b> (<a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=47">divination</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=48">divine</a>) An evangelist automatically knows whether a creature it sees has any of the <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=9">doomed</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=11">dying</a>, and <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=42">wounded</a> conditions, as well as the value of those conditions.<hr /><b>AC</b> 24, <b>Fort</b> +15, <b>Ref</b> +14, <b>Will</b> +11; +1 status to all saves vs. magic<br /><b>HP</b> 90, regeneration 10 (deactivated by good or silver); <b>Immunities</b> cold; <b>Weaknesses</b> good 10, silver 10<br /><b>Unnerving Gaze</b> (<a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=206">aura</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=48">divine</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=61">enchantment</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=68">fear</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=106">mental</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=163">visual</a>) 30 feet. When a creature ends its turn in the aura, it sees the face of a departed loved one in place of the evangelist's face. The creature must succeed at a DC 21 Will save or become <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=19">frightened 2</a> (<a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=19">frightened 3</a> on a critical failure).<br /><b>Attack of Opportunity</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Reaction" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\Reaction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Reaction" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\Reaction_I.png"><hr /><b>Speed</b> 25 feet<br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> chain +17 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=175"><u>disarm</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=192"><u>reach 10 feet</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=196"><u>trip</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 2d8+7 piercing plus 1d6 persistent bleed and impaling chain</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Animate Chains</b> (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=48"><u>divine</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=157"><u>transmutation</a></u>) Chains in the evangelist’s vicinity sprout barbs and writhe menacingly. The evangelist can make chain Strikes against any creature that is adjacent to an unattended chain within 20 feet, in addition to within the reach of its own chain Strike.</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Focus Gaze</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png">  (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=32"><u>concentrate</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=48"><u>divine</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=61"><u>enchantment</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=68"><u>fear</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=106"><u>mental</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=163"><u>visual</a></u>) The evangelist stares at a creature it can see within 30 feet. The target must immediately attempt a Will save against the evangelist’s unnerving gaze. In addition, if the creature was already <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=19">frightened</a>, on a failed save, the evangelist is <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=4">concealed</a> from the creature for as long as the creature remains <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=19">frightened</a>. After attempting this save, the creature is then temporarily immune until the start of the evangelist’s next turn. </span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Impaling Chain</b> When the evangelist critically hits with a chain Strike, the target is impaled and anchored in place, becoming <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Conditions.aspx?ID=20">grabbed</a> by the chain. It’s unable to recover from persistent bleed damage until it gets free (Escape DC 25).</span><h2 class="title">All Monsters in "<a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=111">Velstrac</a>"</h2><table class="inner"><tr><td><b>Name</b></td><td><b>Level</b></td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=460">Augur</a></td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=461">Evangelist</a></td><td>6</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=462">Interlocutor</a></td><td>12</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=463">Precentor</a></td><td>16</td></tr></table><h1 class="title"><a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=111">Velstrac</a></h1><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01zrs?Pathfinder-Adventure-Path-147-Tomorrow-Must-Burn" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Pathfinder #147: Tomorrow Must Burn pg. 82</i></a><br />Velstracs are horrific, shadow-dwelling fiends who seek ultimate sensation through self-mutilation. They transcend their stoic detachment only when inflicting pain and terror upon their victims, practicing new forms of debasement and torture before then turning their knives on themselves. Although velstracs consider themselves beyond such limitations as morality or mortal taboos, their victims know them as emotionless tormentors who inflict debased, sadistic suffering. They claim to seek perfection in thought, form, and action, although they don’t recognize any refinement that doesn’t require the painful excision of the flesh or spirit.<br /><br /> Velstracs manifest from the souls of masochistic or sadistic mortals that are diverted into the Shadow Plane and then forged into forms that suit their vile predilections, ranging from the low-ranking augurs to the aesthetics-obsessed interlocutors.<br /><br /> Some mortals refer to velstracs as “kytons,” a misattribution that the velstracs tolerate with cold amusement. The term “kyton” denotes a master or virtuoso among their kind, and these fiends enjoy being labeled masters of their horrid paths to perfection through agony.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Additional Lore" title="Sidebar - Additional Lore" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png"> Despicable Origins</h3>Velstracs originated with the first debased thoughts of mortals, which the gods found so deplorable that they locked all velstracs away in Hell. It wasn’t long, however, before the newly formed race of velstracs escaped their infernal prison to the Shadow Plane.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Related Creatures" title="Sidebar - Related Creatures" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_4_RelatedCreatures.png"> Other Velstracs</h3>Scholars grimly joke that there are as many different kinds of velstracs as there are ways to skin a cat. The relatively diminutive cantor velstrac poisons the minds of its victims so that they believe they are being clawed from the inside out. The mighty eremites, on the other hand, seek out the most powerful beings to subsume into their own form and lord over all other velstracs save the demagogues.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Related Creatures" title="Sidebar - Related Creatures" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_4_RelatedCreatures.png"> The Shadow Forge</h3>Many velstracs forge their own chains, but others outsource the task to unique velstracs known as almoners. These blind, deaf, and mute velstracs resemble six-armed halflings severed at the waist that toil away endlessly at a great burning foundry called the Shadow Forge. Almoners operate under mysterious strictures, and are just as likely to turn a velstrac away empty-handed as they are to hand one a finely crafted chain before the request has even been uttered.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Additional Lore" title="Sidebar - Additional Lore" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png"> Velstrac Divinities</h3>The most powerful velstracs are unique divinities known collectively as demagogues—powerful creatures often worshipped by mortals who seek to experience agonizing new revelations and gain power by enhancing the body through pain.</span>

  <script>
      initiateToggle(document.getElementById('theme-toggle'));
      initializeMenuToggle(document.getElementById('minMaxMenu'));
      var initializeSearch = function (search) {
          var button;
          var text;
          if (search.firstElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))
              text = search.firstElementChild;
          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))
              text = search.lastElementChild;
          if (search.firstElementChild.classList.contains('search-button'))
              button = search.firstElementChild;
          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-button'))
              button = search.lastElementChild;

          if (search) {
              search.addEventListener('keypress', function (e) {
                  if (e.keyCode == 13) {
                      e.preventDefault();
                      if (text.value != null && text.value.length > 0)
                          window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
                  }
              })
          }
          if (button) {
              button.addEventListener('click', function (e) {
                  window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
              });
          }
      };
      var initializeExpand = function (toggle) {
          var targetAttrString = "[data-target='" + toggle.dataset.toggle + "']";
          //target = menu to be collapsed
          var target = document.querySelector(targetAttrString);
          toggle.addEventListener('click', function () {
              var expanded = target.classList.contains('expanded');
              expanded = !expanded;
              if (expanded) {
                  //hide other in group if exists
                  if (target.dataset.group) {
                      var otherExpanded = document.querySelector('.expanded[data-group="' + target.dataset.group + '"]');
                      if (otherExpanded) {
                          otherExpanded.classList.remove('expanded');
                      }
                  }
                  target.classList.add('expanded');
              } else {
                  target.classList.remove('expanded');
              }
          });
      };
      (function () {
          //toggles = link that expands/collapses target
          var toggles = document.querySelectorAll('[data-toggle]');
          toggles.forEach(function (toggle) {
              initializeExpand(toggle);
          });
          //searches
          var searches = document.querySelectorAll('.search');
          searches.forEach(function (search) {
              initializeSearch(search);
          });
      })();
  </script>
